Welcome to Daily Feats.


A small, simple application to help you keep track of your achievements on your road back from depression.


First time setup takes about 2 minutes.
Which of these statements most closely describes how you\'ve been feeling in the past two weeks?
I frequently or sometimes don\'t get out of bed.
I can get out of bed, but don\'t have the energy to do much else.
I can get through the day, but I don\'t feel content. I feel like my life is missing something.
I don\'t feel depressed right now, and I want to keep it that way.

Freeing yourself from depression is in part about making an effort to keep track of certain important behaviors.


We call each of those positive behaviors a "feat".


Daily Feats will help you record and keep track of the feats you accomplish on a daily basis through the use of a simple daily checklist of goals.
Based on your answer to how you are feeling, Daily Feats will start you with the following list of goals:

Once a day, ideally at the end of the day, you will be asked to evaluate how many of these goals you completed that day.\n\n
The purpose of completing this checklist is to give you an achievable set of goals to work towards, and to help you keep them in mind on a daily basis.

You will also be given the opportunity to record a "Feat of Strength": something positive about the day that will help you remember it from any other day.\n\n
Daily Feats will keep track of all of your feats. Both from your current list, and any Feat of Strength you enter, so that you can always look back and remind yourself of what you have achieved.

Daily Feats will give you a reminder once a day to fill in your feats checklist.


We think a good time for this reminder might be closer to the end of the day, perhaps an hour or two before bed time.


The time for your daily reminder is currently set to:

Daily feats will remind you at the selected time to complete your feats checklist.\n\n
You can always change this time from the Application Settings Menu

An important part of overcoming depression is staying connected to others.


Daily Feats can, whenever you choose to do so, email a group of people with your day's successes.


We recommend you choose a few (at least 1, at most 5) people from your contacts to form your group of supporters. They can be family, significant others, close friends, or anyone else you know.
You can always update your list of supporters from the homepage.

Thank you for completing your first time setup of Daily Feats.\n\n
We look forward to helping you on your journey to wellness, and beyond!
